intro: Jacquemontia euricola, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
